item.title: Amy add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "Some people think love is the end of the road, and if you're lucky enough to find it, you stay there. Other people say it just becomes a cliff you drive off, but most people who've been around awhile know it's just a thing that changes day by day, and depending on how much you fight for it, you get it, or you hold on to it, or you lose it, but sometimes it's never even there in the first place." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Amy add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "She was tired of everyone wanting to go to heaven, nobody wanting to die. The only thing worth grieving over, she said, was that sometimes there was more beauty in this life than the world could bear." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Amy add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Because, once alone, it is impossible to believe that one could ever have been otherwise. Loneliness is an absolute discovery." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Amy add a quote by Barbara Pym
item.description: "You know Mildred would never do anything wrong or foolish. I reflected a little sadly that this was only too true and hoped I did not appear too much that kind of person to others. Virtue is an excellent thing and we should all strive after it, but it can sometimes be a little depressing." -- Barbara Pym

item.title: Amy add a quote by Barbara Pym
item.description: "The burden of keeping three people in toilet paper seemed to me rather a heavy one." -- Barbara Pym

item.title: Amy add a quote by Charles Portis
item.description: "Listen, here's what I'd like to do: I'd like to live in a trailer and play records all night." -- Charles Portis

item.title: Amy add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "I have an idea that the only thing which makes it possible to regard this world we live in without disgust is the beauty which now and then men create out of the chaos. The pictures they paint, the music they compose, the books they write, and the lives they lead. Of all these the richest in beauty is the beautiful life. That is the perfect work of art." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Amy add a quote by Cheryl Strayed
item.description: "The story of human intimacy is one of constantly allowing ourselves to see those we love most deeply in a new, more fractured light. Look hard. Risk that." -- Cheryl Strayed

item.title: Amy add a quote by Cheryl Strayed
item.description: "Forgiveness doesn't sit there like a pretty boy in a bar. Forgiveness is the old fat guy you have to haul up a hill." -- Cheryl Strayed

item.title: Amy add a quote by Cheryl Strayed
item.description: "Don't surrender all your joy for an idea you used to have about yourself that isn't true anymore." -- Cheryl Strayed

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "My life is a reading list." -- John Irving

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Irving
item.description:
"I want to go on being a student," I told him. "I want to be a teacher. I'm just a reader," I said.
"DON'T SOUND SO ASHAMED," he said. "READING IS A GIFT."
"I learned it from you," I told him.
"IT DOESN'T MATTER WHERE YOU LEARNED IT- IT'S A GIFT. IF YOU CARE ABOUT SOMETHING, YOU HAVE TO PROTECT IT. IF YOU'RE LUCKY ENOUGH TO FIND A WAY OF LIFE YOU LOVE, YOU HAVE TO FIND THE COURAGE TO LIVE IT." -- John Irving

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jenny Lawson
item.description: "Because you are defined not by life's imperfect moments, but by your reaction to them. And because there is joy in embracing - rather than running from - the utter absurdity of life." -- Jenny Lawson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Peter Heller
item.description: "Funny how you can live your whole life waiting and not know it... Waiting for your real life to begin. Maybe the most real thing the end. To realize when it's too late. I know now that I loved him more than anything on earth or off of it." -- Peter Heller

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mort Sahl
item.description: "I don't believe in good people and bad people. I believe in the better parts of people." -- Mort Sahl

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Life never gives us what we want at the moment that we consider appropriate." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Amy add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "An honest bookstore would post the following sign above its 'self-help' section: 'For true self-help, please visit our philosophy, literature, history and science sections, find yourself a good book, read it, and think about it." -- Roger Ebert

item.title: Amy add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "He realized that he had thought only about the first step, never imagined the last." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Amy add a quote by Candice Millard
item.description: "during his first year at the Eclectic that, by his second year, the school had promoted him from janitor to assistant professor." -- Candice Millard

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "It was difficult to define her beyond saying that she seemed to exist only as a hostess, not so much from any exaggerated instinct of hospitality as because she could not sustain life except in a crowd." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Some one said the other day that there was a divorce and a case of appendicitis in every family one knows." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "It's rather clever of her to have made a specialty of devoting herself to dull people—the field is such a large one, and she has it practically to herself." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "it is almost as stupid to let your clothes betray that you know you are ugly as to have them proclaim that you think you are beautiful." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emma Straub
item.description: "Once Charles arrived, Franny would start laughing the way she had when she was twenty-four, and the rest of them could start setting one another on fire for all she cared. That’s what best friends did: ruin people for everyone else." -- Emma Straub

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emma Straub
item.description: "She had the wild look of someone who hadn’t slept in twenty-four hours, with purplish semicircles underneath both her eyes. Being eighteen was like being made out of rubber and cocaine." -- Emma Straub

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emma Straub
item.description: "Families were nothing more than hope cast out in a wide net, everyone wanting only the best." -- Emma Straub

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emma Straub
item.description: "Yes, it was true that Franny had gotten thicker in the last decade, but that was what happened unless you were a high-functioning psychotic, and she had other things to think about. Franny knew plenty of women who had chosen to prioritize the eternal youth of their bodies, and they were all miserable creatures, their taut triceps unable to conceal their dissatisfaction with their empty stomachs and unfulfilling lives. Franny liked to eat, and to feed people, and she wasn’t embarrassed that her body displayed such proclivities." -- Emma Straub

item.title: Amy add a quote by Emma Straub
item.description: "Some people smoked crack in alleyways. Franny ate chocolate. On the scale of things, it seemed entirely reasonable." -- Emma Straub

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kelly Corrigan
item.description: "And it occurs to me that maybe the reason my mother was so exhausted all the time wasn’t because she was doing so much but because she was feeling so much." -- Kelly Corrigan
